title._content: ["Welwyn," Harold Irving Pratt house, 100 Crescent Beach Road, Glen Cove, New York. (LOC)

description._content: Johnston, Frances Benjamin,, 1864-1952,, photographer. ["Welwyn," Harold Irving Pratt house, 100 Crescent Beach Road, Glen Cove, New York. Sundial] [ca. 1918] 1 photograph : glass lantern slide, hand-colored ; 3.25 x 4 in. Notes: Site History. House Architecture: Georgian revival house by Babb, Cook & Welsh, 1904-1906, with alterations by Delano & Aldrich, mid-1910s. Landscape: Martha Brookes Brown Hutcheson and James Leal Greenleaf, 1911-1913. Associated Name: Harriet Barnes (Mrs. Harold I.) Pratt. Other: Site and drive planning in "Dosoris," the Pratt family compound of houses belonging to the children of Charles Pratt, Frederick Law Olmsted, Jr., E.C. Whiting, Olmsted Brothers, 1906. The sundial was "The Fruit Bearer" by Edward Francis McCartan. Today: The garden in part preserved as part of the Welwyn Preserve, Glen Cove. The house is the Holocaust Memorial & Tolerance Center of Nassau County. On slide: Unprinted paper mask has the type of gold-border boxes used by slide manufacturer T.H. McAllister-Keller Co., Inc. Title, date, and subject information provided by Sam Watters, 2011. Forms part of: Garden and historic house lecture series in the Frances Benjamin Johnston Collection (Library of Congress). Published in Gardens for a Beautiful America / Sam Watters. New York: Acanthus Press, 2012. Plate 59. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.16811 Call Number: LC-J717-X109- 6
